Indications and doses

Travellers' diarrhoea that is not associated with fever, bloody diarrhoea, blood or leucocytes in the stool, or 8 or more unformed stools in the previous 24 hours,

By mouth

  • For adults
    200 mg every 8 hours for 3 days.

Reduction in recurrence of hepatic encephalopathy,

By mouth

  • For adults
    550 mg twice daily.

Drug action

Rifaximin is a rifamycin that is poorly absorbed from the gastro-intestinal tract, and, therefore, should not be used to treat systemic infections.

Advice when patient is pregnant

Manufacturer advises avoid—toxicity in animal studies.

Advice regarding hepatic impairment

Manufacturer advises caution when used for hepatic encephalopathy in patients with severe hepatic impairment.

Contra indications

  • Intestinal obstruction

Known side effects

General side effects

commonOrVeryCommon: Abdominal pain, depression, diarrhoea, dizziness, dyspnoea, flatulence, headache, muscle spasm, nausea, pruritus, rash, vomiting,

uncommon: Anorexia, antibiotic-associated colitis, anxiety, blood disorders, convulsions, dry mouth, dysuria, glycosuria, hyperkalaemia, hypoaesthesia, influenza-like symptoms, memory impairment, paraesthesia, peripheral oedema, polymenorrhoea, polyuria, sleep disturbances, taste disturbances,

rare: Blood pressure changes, constipation,

notKnown: Syncope,

National funding/access decisions

NICE TA337

Rifaximin for preventing episodes of overt hepatic encephalopathy (March 2015)

Rifaximin is recommended, within its marketing authorisation, as an option for reducing the recurrence of episodes of overt hepatic encephalopathy in adults.

www.nice.org.uk/TA337 www.nice.org.uk/TA337

Information regarding prescribing and dispensing

Not recommended for diarrhoea associated with invasive organisms such as Campylobacter and Shigella .

Advice regarding allergies and cross sensitivities

Contraindicated if history of rifamycin hypersensitivity.

Prepared medicinal forms of RIFAXIMIN

There can be variation in the licensing of different medicines containing the same drug.
